name: Bounding Up to Belle Tout at Birling Gap, South Downs East

ai.summary: A coastal ridge hike of about 8.4 km along the South Downs from Birling Gap to Belle Tout in East Sussex, returning along the same cliff-top route. The moderate path runs over chalk and gravel with exposed sections and sweeping sea views along the coast near the Seven Sisters.
ai.terrain_summary: Cliff-top trails on chalk and gravel with uneven surfaces and some stairs. Exposed edges and windy conditions are common; paths can be muddy after rain, and weather can change quickly near the coast.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and wind conditions before you go; stay well back from cliff edges and follow marked paths; wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers; carry water and snacks; have a map or offline navigation and a charged device; let someone know your plan and allow extra time in case of detours or delays.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing (layers) and a waterproof jacket
Map or offline navigation (GPS/phone) and a charged device
Lightweight backpack with essentials (extra layers, basic first aid)
Optional: windproof gloves or a warm layer for cold/windy days
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) are ideal for mild weather and clear coastal views; winter can be windy, wet, and the cliff paths may be hazardous or closed after storms.

seo.title: Bounding Up to Belle Tout at Birling Gap — South Downs East, UK (8.4 km, Moderate)
seo.meta_description: Embark on an 8.4 km moderate coastal hike from Birling Gap to Belle Tout along the South Downs in East Sussex, UK. Cliff-top trails, sea views, and rugged chalk paths.
seo.h1: Bounding Up to Belle Tout at Birling Gap, South Downs East
